newsitem.title: UK: GDR REPORT-Selective but slim demand in India.
newsitem.headline: GDR REPORT-Selective but slim demand in India.

text.p: Indian global depositary receipts were firm in slim London trade with selective demand for some stocks.
"The market opened selectively higher, there was some demand for better quality stocks," said a trader.
The HSBC James Capel Indian GDR index closed off 0.01 point at 68.94 points, with the premium over the local market at 14.94 percent compared with Thursday's 15.24 percent.
The Bombay Stock Exchange 30-share index closed 0.25 percent higher at 3,435.62.
"There was some demand for SBI and some of the other better quality stocks," said the trader.
State Bank of India GDRs closed up 52 cents at $18.75/$19.50.
"Supply eased back when the domestic market opened up better," said a trader.
The Capel Korea GDR Index ended 0.25 points at 66.49, a premium of 53.82 percent over the local market after the composite stock index closed at a provisional 679.56, up 2.65 points.
The Capel Taiwan GDR Index ended 0.72 points higher at 100.60, a premium of 5.96 percent after the Taiwan Weighted Index added 28.46 points, or 0.39 percent, higher to finish at 7,248.01.
